verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.
verses.web: In the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it around it.
verses.ct: In the 9th year of Zedekiah's reign, on the 10th day of the 10th month, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They set up camp around the city and built siege walls on every side.

verses.kjv: And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.web: So the city was besieged until the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.ct: The siege lasted until the 11th year of King Zedekiah's reign.

verses.kjv: And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.web: On the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.ct: By the 9th day of the 4th month, the famine inside the city had become so severe that there was no food left for the people.

verses.kjv: And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king’s garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city round about:) and the king went the way toward the plain.
verses.web: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden (now the Chaldeans were against the city around it); and the king went by the way of the Arabah.
verses.ct: Then the Babylonians broke through the city wall. Under cover of darkness, all the soldiers fled through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden, even though the Chaldeans had the city surrounded. King Zedekiah escaped toward the Jordan Valley.

verses.kjv: And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.
verses.web: But the Chaldean army pursued the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
verses.ct: But the Chaldean army chased after the king and caught up with him on the plains of Jericho. By then, his entire army had scattered and abandoned him.

verses.kjv: So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.
verses.web: Then they captured the king, and carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they passed judgment on him.
verses.ct: They captured Zedekiah and brought him to King Nebuchadnezzar at Riblah, where judgment was passed on him.

verses.kjv: And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.web: They killed Zedekiah’s sons before his eyes, then put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.ct: They slaughtered Zedekiah's sons right in front of him. Then they gouged out Zedekiah's eyes, bound him in bronze chains, and hauled him off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:
verses.web: Now in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On the 7th day of the 5th month — the 19th year of King Nebuchadnezzar's reign — Nebuzaradan, the captain of the royal guard and a servant of the king of Babylon, arrived in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he burnt the house of the LORD, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man’s house burnt he with fire.
verses.web: He burned LORD’s house, the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, he burned with fire.
verses.ct: He burned down the house of the LORD, the royal palace, and every house in Jerusalem. Every important building was set on fire.

verses.kjv: And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.
verses.web: All the army of the Chaldeans, who were with the captain of the guard, broke down the walls around Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The entire Chaldean army under the captain of the guard tore down the walls surrounding Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carry away.
verses.web: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive the residue of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, then carried away into exile the people still left in the city, those who had deserted to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the population.

verses.kjv: But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
verses.web: But the captain of the guard left some of the poorest of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
verses.ct: But the captain of the guard left behind some of the poorest people in the land to tend the vineyards and work the fields.

verses.kjv: And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the LORD, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.
verses.web: The Chaldeans broke up the pillars of bronze that were in LORD’s house and the bases and the bronze sea that were in LORD’s house, and carried the bronze pieces to Babylon.
verses.ct: The Chaldeans smashed the bronze pillars in the house of the LORD, along with the bronze stands and the great bronze basin called the Sea. They carried all the bronze off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
verses.web: They took away the pots, the shovels, the snuffers, the spoons, and all the vessels of bronze with which they ministered.
verses.ct: They also took the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes, and every bronze utensil used in temple worship.

verses.kjv: And the firepans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.
verses.web: The captain of the guard took away the fire pans, the basins, that which was of gold, in gold, and that which was of silver, in silver.
verses.ct: The captain of the guard seized the firepans and the bowls — everything made of gold and everything made of silver.

verses.kjv: The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the LORD; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.web: The two pillars, the one sea, and the bases, which Solomon had made for LORD’s house, the bronze of all these vessels was not weighed.
verses.ct: The 2 pillars, the great Sea, and the stands that Solomon had made for the house of the LORD — the bronze from all these items was too heavy to weigh.

verses.kjv: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it was brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.
verses.web: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and a capital of bronze was on it. The height of the capital was three cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital around it, all of bronze; and the second pillar with its network was like these.
verses.ct: Each pillar stood 18 cubits tall and was topped with a bronze capital 3 cubits high. The capital was decorated all around with a network of bronze chains and bronze pomegranates. Both pillars were identical in design.

verses.kjv: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
verses.web: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold;
verses.ct: The captain of the guard arrested Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank, and the 3 doorkeepers of the temple.

verses.kjv: And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king’s presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land that were found in the city:
verses.web: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and five men of those who saw the king’s face, who were found in the city; and the scribe, the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the city.
verses.ct: From the city he also seized a military officer in charge of the soldiers, 5 men from the king's personal advisors who were found in the city, the chief scribe of the army who was responsible for drafting the people of the land into service, and 60 ordinary citizens found within the city.

verses.kjv: And Nebuzaradan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:
verses.web: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, took all of them and brought them to King Nebuchadnezzar at Riblah.

verses.kjv: And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.
verses.web: The king of Babylon attacked them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon had them struck down and executed at Riblah in the land of Hamath. And so Judah was dragged away from its homeland into exile.

verses.kjv: And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.
verses.web: As for the people who were left in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, governor.
verses.ct: Over the people who remained in the land of Judah — those Nebuchadnezzar had left behind — he appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, as governor.

verses.kjv: And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
verses.web: Now when all the captains of the forces, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.
verses.ct: When the military commanders and their men heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, they came to him at Mizpah. Among them were Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Careah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah son of a Maachathite, along with their men.

verses.kjv: And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.
verses.web: Gedaliah swore to them and to their men, and said to them, “Don’t be afraid because of the servants of the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it will be well with you.”
verses.ct: Gedaliah gave them and their men a sworn oath, saying, "Don't be afraid of the Chaldeans. Settle down in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and things will go well for you."

verses.kjv: But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.
verses.web: But in the seventh month, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal offspring came, and ten men with him, and struck Gedaliah, so that he died, with the Jews and the Chaldeans that were with him at Mizpah.
verses.ct: But in the 7th month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama — a man of royal blood — came with 10 men and assassinated Gedaliah, along with the Jews and Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.

verses.kjv: And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.
verses.web: All the people, both small and great, and the captains of the forces, arose, and came to Egypt; for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: After that, all the people — from the least to the greatest — along with the military commanders, fled to Egypt because they were terrified of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;
verses.web: In the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, Evilmerodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;
verses.ct: In the 37th year of King Jehoiachin of Judah's exile, on the 27th day of the 12th month, Evilmerodach became king of Babylon. In the very first year of his reign, he released Jehoiachin from prison.

verses.kjv: And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon;
verses.web: and he spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,
verses.ct: He treated Jehoiachin with kindness and gave him a seat of honor above all the other exiled kings in Babylon.

verses.kjv: And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.
verses.web: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life;
verses.ct: Jehoiachin exchanged his prison clothes for fine garments and ate at the king's table for the rest of his life.

verses.kjv: And his allowance was a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.
verses.web: and for his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him from the king, every day a portion, all the days of his life.
verses.ct: The king provided him with a regular daily allowance to cover his needs for as long as he lived.
